na venely amen ta ingcay, qaqilj kata daikung.
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。

aza i gidi a paveliveli ta kudamunu a tawki qivu:“ a ku pangudralj kata qudis qaljemeqem. veliu tu keri pay!”
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”
我今天七點到學校。: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」

na veneli amen ta pangudralj kata qudis.
We bought pineapples and peaches.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。

ka cemalivat amen ta paveliveli tua vutjulj, aza tawki qivu anema su velin? kasauny a vuyu kudral tu qalev, nu ita tjelu taidai a paisu.
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”
我今天七點到學校。: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」

paka pazangal ti vuvu vavayan, kivadaqan a tawki tuki maqati a pumadjuluing.
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.
我今天七點到學校。: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。

ljakua aya tawki madjulu anga, dikinay anga kiluvadan.
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.
我今天七點到學校。: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。

aza i tjuljivar a tawki qivu, idu veliu ta ku ciqaw, a ku ciqaw kudral tu madjulu.
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.
我今天七點到學校。: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。

kavililjanga venely a men ta vuyu kata ciqaw tauta, sema tjumaq kemesa ta tacukui a djamay.
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.
我今天七點到學校。: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。

kemaljava cuayanga, masulem anga a kalevelevan.
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.
我今天七點到學校。: 等了好久，天已經黑了。

ti kaka tjakeri a uqaljay padingwa mangetjez a qivu, papintjus tu ika semekez anga i sividay, nu tjaivililj a niciubi mana dikilu a mangetjez.
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.
我今天七點到學校。: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。

aya ti vuvu vavayan liaw a kinesanga, qaqivu a mapuljat kaciruri a keman!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!
我今天七點到學校。: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!

na djemaulj a men ta marekasusu kata qalialian, maciul paselingulj a keman.
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。

izua u dukiusi ti kapi, timadju ru draudraw kemacu ta nemanga.
I have a classmate named Kapi, he often forgets to bring things.
我今天七點到學校。: 我有一個同學叫Kapi，他常常忘記帶東西。

ka kitulutul amen, na kisedjam timadju ta na dukiusi a inpic, siquliqulip kata qadupu.
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.
我今天七點到學校。: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。

puita, pudrusa, putjelu, aza salasaladj pukaui a pasedjam ta nemanga tjaimadju.
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.
我今天七點到學校。: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。

izua damidami a kakudan nimadju, ru kisedjam ta nemanga sa ika pacikel anga.
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.
我今天七點到學校。: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。

kavililjanga a mapuljat ika sa pasedjam ta nemanga tjaimadju.
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.
我今天七點到學校。: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。

izua tu ita qadaw, na maciul amen vaik a kivanvan.
One day, we all went on an outing together.
我今天七點到學校。: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。

ka i kadjalanan, sa mabinziu ti kapi, ljakua madraudraw kemacu timadju ta sidjuadjuas.
On the way, Kapi wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.
我今天七點到學校。: 路途中，kapi想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。

na kisedjam timadju ta salasaladj ta sidjuadjuas, ljakua maitucu temevela a mapuljat tjaimadju, ika nakemacu a ken tauta.
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.
我今天七點到學校。: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。

ti kapi qemauqaung ta latjakan, matjalaw timadju qivu, akumaya ika nu pasedjaman na ken ta sidjuadjuas!!
Kapi burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!
我今天七點到學校。: kapi急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!!

tjumaljang na salasaladj timadju, lja ika sun na rukacut, saka nu pasedjaman sun ta nemanga, ika sun na pacikel.
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!
我今天七點到學校。: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!

kamaljia magaku, medjama sema gaku ti kapi, aza kinisedjam ta salasaladj a nemanga pinacikel anga penuljat ta dukiusi.
The next day at school, Kapi arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.
我今天七點到學校。: 隔天上學，kapi很早就到學校了，Kapi把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。

ti kapi kipaqaljay ta dukiusi, sa qivu nu tjaivililj tjara kemacu ta niaken a nemanga, masalu tjanumun ka tjaisangas pukaui a pasedjam ta nemanga tja nuaken.
Kapi apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.
我今天七點到學校。: kapi向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。

a ku kama na i qinaljan a cinunan.
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。

ka qaqunuan na ken, ti kama kati djisan nu itua qezemezemetj vaik a ljesasaw, kemacu ta tjakit kata kuwang.
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.
我今天七點到學校。: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。

numaljia, mangetjez tiamadju a na kemacu ta djinameq a sacemel.
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.
我今天七點到學校。: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。

nucuayanga vavuy, nucuayanga lava, nuaya izua padjavatan uta.
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.
我今天七點到學校。: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。

aza sacemel qaluqaluten niamadju i siljitaladj tua qinaljan a paljing, pasleva tua sikataqaljan.
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。

sakamaya ru qemevaw a ken tja kama, sa kiciul a qemaljup kati kama.
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.
我今天七點到學校。: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。

aya ti kama nu meqaca sun, ku su kacuaw anga.
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸說等我長大了，他再帶我一起去。

a i qinaljan a uqaljaqaljay macaqu a pudringay djemekep ta sacemel, tiamadju saigu cukulu ta veceqel a dringay kata siqezetjan tua qaciljay a dringay.
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.
我今天七點到學校。: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。

a ku kama saigu a cukulu ta veceqel a dringay, aya ti kama, aicu uli sidringay ta padjavatan, tja kigaljuing a ljemengljeng za na sacemel a djekap, za dringay tja pizuaing ta na sacemel vinaikan a djaljan.
My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

ulja dikilu a kilimu kata ramaljeng maciul a qemaljup, nu ljemita qadaw kicaquan a cukulu ta dringay, aza u dringay uli palamu anga paqulid a maqati djemameq tua sacemel.
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.
我今天七點到學校。: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。

ti ka pacunan na ken qivu tjanuaken, nu tjaivililj tjara masan saiguan sun a cinunan.
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸看到後對我說,我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。

tucu meqacanga ken, ku sevaljeng a u panaq kata vakela, kiciul ta ku kama vaik a qemaljup.
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.
我今天七點到學校。: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。

ka sema qinaljan, aza nia djinameq a sacemel uli pasleva tua sikataqaljan.
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 回村時，將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。

aya ti kama, masalu aravac tana qemati a sinipagaugaw. pavayan itjen tu liaw ta sacemel a manguaqan.
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸說，要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。

ta kadjaman gemalju aken a ma tatakisian.
I was late for school this morning.
我今天七點到學校。: 我早上上學遲到了。

tazua vayke sema tatakesiyan, ini paqenedjanga aken a masi qabang.
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.
我今天七點到學校。: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。

ini ken na kemacu ta nanemangau.
I didn’t bring anything with me.
我今天七點到學校。: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。

a kitulutulu tazua, maciyul a pacun ta kadup aken kata dukiwsi.
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.
我今天七點到學校。: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。

a semekiseking tazua, pasedjaman aken ta inpic kata sisumasumang na dukiwsi.
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.
我今天七點到學校。: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。

kakivuin aken na sinsi, “nu djavililj gacaljuanga kilimu, maya gemalj anga!”
The teacher told me, “Wake up earlier next time and don’t be late again!”
我今天七點到學校。: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」

ti kadrw a ku ’aliyan angta.
My good friend’s name is kadrw, and he is also an Paiwan child.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的好朋友叫kadrw，他也是排灣族的小孩。

na maciyul a men a kisupu i kaaluwan.
We study together in the kaaluwan tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們一起在kaaluwan讀書。

djaluljes amen a maciyul kilangda ta djawcikel a milimilimgan na lamaljeng, macaqu amen qivu ta pinaywanan.
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Paiwan proficiently.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說排灣語。

ljavavaw aken sa mekaca, ti kadrw maliljay sa kedrikedri.
I am tall and overweight, while kadrw is short and thin.
我今天七點到學校。: 我很高也很胖，kadrw很矮也很瘦。

lu talivakan ti kadraw, djengelay a men djay madju a mapuljat.
kadrw is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.
我今天七點到學校。: kadrw很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。

ungdukay na i gaku tu sa qadaw, maljeliyav a kamuku sinipa malalumaljan na gaku.
Today was the school’s sports day, and the school organized many competitions.
我今天七點到學校。: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。

izua malalakac ta calis, sema kula a benulu, mekelj, dremaiyan, katua penana.
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.
我今天七點到學校。: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。

ta mekelj a ku malalumaljan.
I participated in the running competition.
我今天七點到學校。: 我比賽跑步。

tazua a mekelj aken, sekulilj aken, pedjamu tu liyav a cungal.
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.
我今天七點到學校。: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。

ljakua migacalj aken, sa pazulunge a mekelj a pasasangas.
But I stood up and continued running forward.
我今天七點到學校。: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。

maleva cawcaw anga a djemaljun aken.
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.
我今天七點到學校。: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。

nuavan na ini a malap ta sangasangasa. ljaqua maleva ken alavac. ayatua na paudeze anga ken tua kinimalalumaljan.
Although I didn’t get first place, I’m glad because I completed the race.
我今天七點到學校。: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。

na paljilji ta ku ama aken ati kama ta tiyiv.
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.
我今天七點到學校。: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。

na mapasa’edju a kula ni ama.
My uncle injured his foot.
我今天七點到學校。: 叔叔的腳受傷了。

djmaljan amen ni madjuna, makapalaq tu ita beleng a na umaq a ’aljiv.
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.
我今天七點到學校。: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。

a ljemengungu ta ’aljiv na umaq ti madju, makelu anga kemasi ta umaq na ’aljiv.
He fell off the roof while repairing it.
我今天七點到學校。: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。

na kemacu ti kama ta na gung a vudjulj ‘ata saviki sipavay djay ama.
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。

i ’umaan a mazazepezep a ken ati ama.liyav a milimilinga sini djawcikel ni madju.
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。

a muri vayika anga ken, zemengel ti ama tu mekacanga ken, mapavalit tu djasawqaljay tu.
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.
我今天七點到學校。: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。

’evu ken, “nu menguwa anga su kula ama, keljuanga ta nia umaq kivangavang nu djayvililj tu.”
I said, “When your foot gets better, come to our house next time and visit us.”
我今天七點到學校。: 我說：「等叔叔腳好了，下次也來我們家玩。」

i ta drusa kuzulj sa drusa pulu sa drusa cavilj, na kaygi anga a asihu a pita mibungsiw na kacalisiyan ta ngadan makayanga pasa ita ngadan nua kinacalisianan.
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.
我今天七點到學校。: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。

na humung aken ta cuacuayanga kilevuci pasa ta sihu a pita mibusuw pizuwanan ta “pasa ita ngadan na kinacalisian’’ i qinalja a maacuvucuvung. lja savan ti camaq.
I interviewed camaq, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.
我今天七點到學校。: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年camaq。

tucu a sisekesekez a qadaw na pinedjan aken ati madju tu mazuwa ta umaq nimadj a humung.
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。

a humung tazuw, pasemalaven aken ni madju tu pinakasinuan a ngadan ni madju, utanga kacuin aken a pakeljang ta tacekeljan ni madju, ta qinaljan ni madju.
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。

ku kivadaan ti madju a kumaya ki temezeng pasupavalit ta ngadan, nakuya sipavecikana a kakudanan ta sicuayan.
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?
我今天七點到學校。: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?

kakivuin aken ni madju, ayatua na sipavecikan ta ciniwkukan ini a mapacengceng a pkeljangn ta ngadan ni madju, azuma cawcaw maytucu anan a qivu “ca sinsi” ut manasika sidjawljan tu paseliyaw tua penapedjeli.
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him “Cha Xian Sheng”, which resulted in many jokes being made.
我今天七點到學校。: 他對我說，因為用中文字並不能準確的傳達他的名字，其他人還會叫他「查先生」，也因此鬧出不少笑話。

lja savan ti camaq kivu, “a tja kaulidan a ngadan nu kinakacalisiyan a sivecikan ta ngadan mavan na djaljemedjem, aza ku ngadan sikaqeljangan tu anema men nu zukan, ljanema men a djumaan, nidjen a kinapatalevanan i kacawan. puzangalan tu makaya maljeliav azukan a cawcaw kipakim ta su kiningadangan.”
camaq kivu said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group
我今天七點到學校。: our family
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/35005/5: our identity. I hope more fellow tribespeople can reclaim their own names.\""
column5: camaq kivu說：「原住民語書寫的名字才是我們真正的名字。我的名字代表了我們的族群、我們的家族、我們的身分，希望能有更多族人找回自己的名字。」

ta tiyav ti aken kati vuvu avavayan vayke a ma icipa ta papaveliyanan, na kemacu ti vuvu avavayan ta liyav a namakakayzuazua a sinitalem a lacing, utanga sikipualan ta na kacalisiyan a kakanen sipakan tua mapuljat.
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.
我今天七點到學校。: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。

na djengelay a mapuljat ta ni vuvu a papaveliyanan, a kamangulj ata luni maljeleav a cawcaw veneli, maljeleav a cawcaw mangedjez a keman ta sinanljaceng ni madju.
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.
我今天七點到學校。: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和車輪茄很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。

sanguwa alavac a kines ni madju a lukuce kata djuadjuay a kinsa. izuanan a siljatu ta vavuy pinasazuan ta daykung kata tjana, aza saluman masiljudje ta maljeliyav a kaljakalja. mangdjez a mapuljat sa madjuljul ita niamen a papaveliyan.
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.
我今天七點到學校。: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的馬告滷肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。

nu kemesakesa ta nemanga ti vuvu, i djuljival aken a djemawdjaulj ta kaljakalja. i djuljival a ken a mezangal a djemawdjaw, “a ljaceng savtde a niya sinitalem, ini a pinizuanan ta kahiliyuan a si vevuan, veliyu a kilalimu lja!”
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown
我今天七點到學校。: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/35005/5: 奶奶煮東西的時候，我在旁邊招攬客人。我在一旁大喊著：「蔬菜都是自己種的，天然有機，趕快來買喔!」

a nia nemanga ma veli a kilimu, kivuta vuvu, “masa izuwa sun a paqeljing.”
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, “It’s all thanks to your help.”
我今天七點到學校。: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」

aicua a kinipusengsenganan, izua ku kinituluan paka ta kacalisiyan a zazumuk katuwa sikeljangan ta kakanen a kakudan, mayanga izua nga kinakeljangan ta kipusngesngan ita papavelian aza luljayan.
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.
我今天七點到學校。: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。

pacunan ti vuvu djengelay alavaca tua semicuacuayan a kakanen, djevalungan aken ta samamaljian a acianan atuwa puzangalan.
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
我今天七點到學校。: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
